Prodigy Recipe¶

Imports¶

fastaimodel recipe¶

fastai_recipe[source]

fastai_recipe(dataset:('The dataset to use', 'positional', None, <class 'str'>), source:('Path to a directory of images', 'option', 'source', <class 'str'>), model_path:('Path to the fastai model', 'option', 'model', <class 'str'>), target_folder:('Path to the target folder where the pictures are in the labled folders', 'option', 'target_folder', <class 'str'>), sort_by_score_type:', 'option', 'sort', <class 'str'>), label:('One or more comma-separated labels', 'option', 'label', <class 'str'>)='horse_poo')

recipe to load data in a certain order and save them to a folder

create_folders[source]

create_folders(path:str, label:str)

create the target folder

# check if folder do not exist
if os.path.exists('horse_poo'): Path('horse_poo').rmdir()
if os.path.exists('no_horse_poo'): Path('no_horse_poo').rmdir()
create_folders('.', 'horse_poo')
assert Path('horse_poo').exists() is True
assert Path('no_horse_poo').exists() is True

load_fastai_model[source]

load_fastai_model(path, test_folder:Path'>, <class 'str'>]=None)

load a fastai model from a given path

if os.path.exists('data/export.pkl'):
    model = load_fastai_model('data/export.pkl')
    if os.path.exists('test_data/sample/20181216093008.jpg'):
        prediction = model.predict(fastai.vision.open_image('test_data/sample/20181216093008.jpg'))        
        assert type(model) == fastai.basic_train.Learner
     
    model = load_fastai_model('data/export.pkl', 'test_data/sample')
    preds = model.get_preds(ds_type=DatasetType.Test)
    assert type(preds) == list
    assert len(preds) == 2
    assert preds[0][0,:].shape == torch.Size([2])

save_base64_image[source]

save_base64_image(path, filename, uri)

save base64 encoded image

score_stream[source]

score_stream(stream, model_path)

fastai_jsonl_recipe¶

predict_folder[source]

predict_folder(image_folder:Path'>], path_model:Path'>]=PosixPath('data/export.pkl'))

predicts a folder of images and saves images in tasks.jsonl

if os.path.exists('data/export.pkl'):
    predict_folder(image_folder=Path('test_data/sample/'), path_model='data/export.pkl')

predict_all_subfolders[source]

predict_all_subfolders(path:"path of parent folder"='data', skipXmostRecent:"skips the nth most recent folders"=1, path_model:"path to the model to use"='data/export.pkl', predict_single_folder:"path to single folder"=None)

predicts all images in subfolders of the given path an creates a tasks.jsonl file

fastai_jsonl_recipe[source]

fastai_jsonl_recipe(dataset:('The dataset to use', 'positional', None, <class 'str'>), path_image_folder:jsonl file', 'option', 'path_image_folder', <class 'str'>), path_model:('folder where we can find the deployed model', 'option', 'path_model', <class 'str'>), predict:jsonl or not', 'option', 'predict', <class 'int'>)=0)

recipe to predict and laod data in a certain order

if os.path.exists('data/export.pkl'):
    res = fastai_jsonl_recipe('test', 'test_data/sample', 'data/export.pkl', 1)
    res['on_load']('controller')
    assert os.path.exists('test_data/sample/tasks.jsonl')
    os.unlink('test_data/sample/tasks.jsonl')
    

from nbdev.export import *
notebook2script('01_custom_receipe.ipynb')

!prodigy fastai_jsonl_recipe binary_horse_poo \
-path_image_folder /mnt/Data/to_label/all/ \
-path_model /home/wilhelm/PooDetector/data/tmp/export.pkl \
-predict 0 \
-F /home/wilhelm/PooDetector/PooDetector/custom_recipe.py

✨  Starting the web server at http://0.0.0.0:9010 ...
Open the app in your browser and start annotating!


!python PooDetector/custom_recipe.py \
--path /mnt/Data/to_label/ \
--path_model /home/wilhelm/PooDetector/data/tmp/export.pkl 

!python PooDetector/custom_recipe.py -h

usage: custom_recipe.py [-h] [--path PATH] [--skipXmostRecent SKIPXMOSTRECENT]
                        [--path_model PATH_MODEL]
                        [--predict_single_folder PREDICT_SINGLE_FOLDER]

predicts all images in subfolders of the given path an creates a tasks.jsonl
file

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --path PATH           path of parent folder
  --skipXmostRecent SKIPXMOSTRECENT
                        skips the nth most recent folders
  --path_model PATH_MODEL
                        path to the model to use
  --predict_single_folder PREDICT_SINGLE_FOLDER
                        path to single folder
